Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'human aging' to someone reading at the Early Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 50 words that follows your plan. (The 50 words should explain what aging is and how it affects humans.)

Aging is when people grow older. It happens to everyone. As we age, our bodies change. We might move slower, need glasses to see, or have less energy. Our skin wrinkles too. But aging also means gaining wisdom and experience. It's a normal part of life.

Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'human aging' to someone reading at the Early Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 50 words that follows your plan. Remember to check that your paragraph is clear, accurate, and simple.

Human aging is when people grow old. As we get older, our body changes. We might not run as fast or see as well. Our skin might wrinkle. Our hair may turn gray or fall out. Inside our body, things change too. Cells get older and don't work as well. Our heart might not pump as strongly. We might need more rest. But don't worry, we still have lots of time to play, learn, and explore.

Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'human aging' to someone reading at the Early Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 50 words that follows your plan. Remember to use a transition at the end to help the reader know that your paragraph is finished.

Human aging is like a plant growing. We start as a tiny seed, then grow into a big, strong tree. But unlike plants, we don't stay the same size forever. Instead, our bodies change slowly over time. We get taller, then stop growing. Our hair changes color, and our skin gets wrinkles. This is all part of growing up and getting older, just like a plant does. In the end, we become wise and experienced, just like an old tree.

Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'human aging' to someone reading at the Early Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 50 words that follows your plan. Here's the paragraph:

Aging is when people get older. It starts at birth and happens to everyone. As time goes by, our bodies change. We grow taller, then stop. Our hair turns gray or white. We might need glasses to see far away. Our bones and muscles get weaker. But, our brains keep learning and growing! We become wise and have many stories to tell. Aging is a normal part of life.

Step 4: Review your paragraph to ensure it meets the criteria:
- Uses simple, Early Elementary-level vocabulary
- Explains human aging in an age-appropriate way
- Is 50 words in length

Step 5: If necessary, make revisions to ensure your paragraph meets all the criteria.
